abstract: Johnny Burris filed complaints with his bosses, and when the bank fired him, he got no chance to defend himself, he says, and then black marks appeared on his record.
snippet: Johnny Burris filed complaints with his bosses, and when the bank fired him, he got no chance to defend himself, he says, and then black marks appeared on his record.
lead_paragraph: “Whistle-blowers often face the difficult choice between telling the truth and the risk of committing career suicide,” said a Senate report on the Dodd-Frank Wall Street reform act, which bars retaliation against whistle-blowers.

headline.main: He Was a JPMorgan Chase Whistle-Blower. Then Came the Blowback.
headline.print_headline: He Blew the Whistle, Then Came Blowback
